Unsourced material may be challenged and removed. *Find sources:* "Veredus Laboratories" – news **·** newspapers **·** books **·** scholar **·** JSTOR *(August 2022)* *(Learn how and when to remove this message)* **Veredus Laboratories** is a medical device company in [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore) specializing in developing portable diagnostic tool kits. Veredus Laboratories was founded in 2003 by Dr. Rosemary Tan. The company released its first product in 2006. In July 2005, Veredus Laboratories launched a DNA- and RNA-based diagnostic kits for [dengue](/wiki/Dengue), [avian influenza](/wiki/Avian_influenza) and [malaria](/wiki/Malaria). The kit is based on technologies licensed from [A*STAR](/wiki/A*STAR) and the [National University of Singapore](/wiki/National_University_of_Singapore). In January 2006, Veredus Laboratories and [STMicroelectronics](/wiki/STMicroelectronics) announced a joint effort in the development of a rapid diagnostic kit for [avian influenza](/wiki/Avian_influenza) and other [influenza](/wiki/Influenza) viruses which could produces a result within an hour, based on [Lab-on-a-chip](/wiki/Lab-on-a-chip) (LOC) technology. In July 2006, Veredus Laboratories set up an on-board [avian influenza](/wiki/Avian_influenza) testing laboratory on [USS *Blue Ridge*](/wiki/USS_Blue_Ridge_(LCC-19)), the flagship of the [United States 7th Fleet](/wiki/United_States_7th_Fleet), and on the aircraft carrier [USS *Kitty Hawk*](/wiki/USS_Kitty_Hawk_(CV-63)). Veredus Laboratories released VereTrop in April 2013, a biochip that can diagnose 13 different varieties of tropical diseases from a single blood sample. A year later in May 2014, the company released VereMERS, a lab-on-a-chip application capable of detecting the coronavirus that causes Middle East Respiratory Syndrome. In April 2018, Veredus Laboratories was acquired by Sekisui Chemical Co. - Official Website - Electric Hospital Bed - *Singapore-made Avian Flu Test Kit* (newsletter Dec05/Jan06), Singapore Embassy in Washington This [Singaporean corporation or company](/wiki/List_of_companies_of_Singapore) article is a stub.
